image.altText: A close-up photo of a young man wearing a collared shirt and tie.

items.synopsis: A phone call made by 20-year-old Kobee Huddy to a mental health support line hours before he was shot in Adelaide's west after threatening police has been played to a coronial inquest into his death. WARNING: The following article contains details that may distress some readers.

title.children: Helpline operator told man she had no 'magical advice' hours before he was shot dead by police

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks signage at the clubs headquarters in Melbourne.

items.synopsis: The players and families at the centre of the Hawthorn cultural safety review have released an open letter saying they were "betrayed" by the club as they officially lodge a complaint with the Australian Human Rights Commission.

title.children: Players and families at centre of Hawthorn cultural safety review lodge human rights complaint

image.altText: A man outside an Adelaide court with his lawyer.

items.synopsis: Two members of a neo-Nazi group found with instructions on how to carry out a terrorist attack have been sentenced to more than two years behind bars.

title.children: Neo-Nazi group members jailed for 'abhorrent and distressing' crimes

image.altText: A man in a suit looking down

items.synopsis: Ben Roberts-Smith resigns from his job at Seven West Media, as the company's billionaire chairman Kerry Stokes says the imputations found to be true in yesterday's crushing court judgement do "not accord with the man I know".

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith resigns from Seven as war crimes judgement reverberates around globe

image.altText: An unidentifiable woman in a wheelchair at home on her own.

items.synopsis: The federal government is working on a new law to explicitly make it illegal to charge more for products and services because a client is on the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

title.children: 'Shouldn't view the NDIS as a chance to build a verandah on their beach house': Government announces crackdown on inflated prices for NDIS services

image.altText: A Mac laptop resting on a bed in the dark

items.synopsis: Police will allege the victims handed the money over for investment schemes for their retirement, but the suspect used the money for other purposes.

title.children: 80yo man charged for allegedly scamming $700k from elderly people

image.altText: Teddy bears sit in the window of a hospital near a sign that reads Women's and Children's Hospital Adelaide

items.synopsis: One in five trainee doctors at each of South Australia's major public hospitals felt they were recently bullied or harassed, according to data compiled from a national survey.

title.children: Bullying still prevalent in South Australian hospitals but junior doctors fear repercussions from reporting

items.synopsis: A 5.75 per cent boost to award wages is massive and will affect millions of workers. But inflation means they'll still have less to spend, writes Daniel Ziffer.

title.children: Inflation means only rare workers are getting ahead, despite award wage boost

image.altText: A woman holds a sign which reads 'arrest me pete'

items.synopsis: South Australia's parliament has passed laws increasing the fine and adding jail time for obstructing a public place in response to Extinction Rebellion protests in Adelaide. But legal experts have raised questions about the wording of the law and its potential consequences.

title.children: South Australia's protest laws are changing. Here's how

image.altText: A tall man in military uniform speaks with Queen Elizabeth in an ornate room

items.synopsis: Once a hero to politicians and civilians alike, a court found the 44-year-old's reputation is now so lowered that two unproven allegations of battlefield murder weren't enough to defame him.

title.children: From 'Australian hero' to 'disgracing' his country — inside a decorated soldier's massive fall

image.altText: Several photographers point cameras at a man, who is standing, looking on.

items.synopsis: The memorial says it will continue to display disgraced war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith's uniform and medals for now, but will consider adding context.

title.children: Ben Roberts-Smith's memorabilia to remain on display at Australian War Memorial

image.altText: An indigenous man wearing a black shirt and an Aboriginal flag themed beanie

items.synopsis: Like so many communities around the nation, Port Augusta residents came together this week to recognise the country's ongoing journey to reconciliation.

title.children: Port Augusta locals weigh up the Voice amid a time for healing

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

items.synopsis: Federal Education Minister Jason Clare has left the door open for changes to how HECS-HELP debts are paid back, including how indexation is applied to the original debt.

title.children: Government open to changes on how indexation applies to HECS-HELP debt

image.altText: a man wearing a cap looking at the camera

items.synopsis: Argyle Bar owner Samantha Ford alleged that in 2022, former cricketer Stuart MacGill had screamed and threatened her while drinking with her ex-partner at The Rocks in Sydney.

title.children: Ex-cricket star Stuart MacGill sheds tear as he is cleared of intimidating, threatening Sydney bar owner

image.altText: A line of police, some armed, standing behind plastic wrapped packaged piles of cocaine.

items.synopsis: Police find 29 packages of the drug hidden onboard a bulk cargo carrier bound for Western Australia, in one of the largest cocaine busts in decades.

title.children: Police seize 800kg of cocaine from bulk carrier in one of Australia's biggest-ever drug busts

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing black glasses standing in front of a blurry australian flag looking straight toward the camera

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says the court ruling against decorated war veteran Ben Roberts-Smith was a "tough day for the country" and believes there has been a "significant culture change" at the Australian Defence Force.

title.children: Dutton says Roberts-Smith ruling a 'tough day for our country' as Taliban alleges there were 'uncountable crimes'

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: The government's proposal is expected to increase the pay of about 2 per cent of its workforce. These charts show exactly who those staff are.

title.children: Which public servants will receive salary boosts under the plan to fix pay gaps?

image.altText: US Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer gives a thumbs up and smiles.

items.synopsis: The US Senate passes bipartisan legislation backed by President Joe Biden that lifts the government's $31.4 trillion debt ceiling, averting what would have been a first-ever default.

title.children: US averts historic default with 11th-hour deal to lift debt ceiling

image.altText: Daniel Ben Barnett pleaded guilty to seven domestic violence offenders.

items.synopsis: Daniel Ben Barnett will spend at least 16 months in jail for domestic violence offences, with the sentencing magistrate noting his actions had intruded on the victim's life in every aspect.

title.children: Man jailed for tracking ex-lover's car, bugging her home

image.altText: Players stand together as they pose for a team photo

items.synopsis: The Adelaide Thunderbirds were the first team to host an Indigenous game at the national level in 2013. One of their foundation players from 16 years prior says more can be done to recognise the club's past First Nations talent, writes Brittany Carter.

title.children: Ten years on, Thunderbirds showcase their cultural leadership during First Nations Round

image.altText: A woman looks at a pile of jeans in a clothing store.

items.synopsis: Australia's minimum wage lifts by 8.6 per cent, award workers get 5.75 per cent increase, in Fair Work Commission decision.

title.children: Australia's minimum wage jumps by 8.6 per cent, award workers get 5.75 per cent pay boost

image.altText: A media scrum surrounds Mark McGowan's car

items.synopsis: Outgoing premier Mark McGowan receives a rock star reception from waiting media as he arrives for his final day in the state's top job, insisting he has no regrets.

title.children: 'I'm going to watch some Netflix': Mark McGowan has no regrets on his final day as WA premier

image.altText: A young woman standing at a cash register looks at a woman sorting her groceries in a trolley.

items.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission announces a 5.75 per cent increase in award wages, putting a dent in the share prices of retailers and other labour-intensive firms. Here's how the day went down on the ASX.

title.children: Bigger-than-expected award wages increase sinks major retail stocks — as it happened

image.altText: A group of solar panels on a roof through the frame of leafy trees.

items.synopsis: Rocketing power prices have reignited interest in rooftop solar, but are low feed-in tariffs discouraging people from taking the plunge?

title.children: Claims of 'rip-off' as solar feed-in tariffs plummet even as power prices soar

image.altText: A man kneeling in front of a wall and a sculpture of a large bird. The wall has faces of people painted on it.

items.synopsis: A Riverland council has opened its Healing Place near a hospital, a communal space for people waiting for medical appointments and an innovative way to spark discussion about the future of Australia.

title.children: Healing Place opens with hopes of better health outcomes and a reconciled Australia

image.altText: Two people stand on a beach near the wreckage of two helicopters.

items.synopsis: CASA is reviewing the airspace where two helicopters collided on the Gold Coast, killing four people. But an aviation industry consultant says they may be "preparing themselves" for the outcome of a wider ATSB investigation due next year.

title.children: CASA review of Sea World helicopter crash airspace 'window dressing', says aviation expert

image.altText: Four mobile phones in various states of disrepair are pieced by rusty nails to the trunk of a tree

items.synopsis: In a basement in a Ukrainian village on the Russian border, the remnants of a torture chamber tell a horrifying tale. Those investigating what happened here say the depraved orders came from the top. WARNING: Readers might find the details in this story distressing.

title.children: When Russians arrived in this village, they nailed all the phones to a tree. Then locals say the torture began

image.altText: An island resort that is now over grown and run down

items.synopsis: Developer Benny Wu is at the centre of legal action over a dilapidated former destination for Hollywood stars as he faces further scrutiny over other run-down properties in Queensland's far north.

title.children: Hong Kong billionaire may lose tropical Queensland island 'jewel' as properties fall into disrepair

image.altText: A woman in a shirt, short and caps stands next to a wood barrier by the beach.

items.synopsis: Peripheral artery disease is described as a "silent killer", but women don't always show traditional symptoms, which is leading to underdiagnosis.

title.children: Danielle was given a choice — her leg or her life. She wants others to recognise the signs of this 'silent killer'

image.altText: Dirt flows from a hole in a metal construction wall underground.

items.synopsis: No workers were injured in a minor underground collapse on the road tunnel project in Melbourne's inner west.

title.children: Workers evacuated after tunnel collapse hundreds of metres underground on major Melbourne project

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

items.synopsis: Police are continuing to investigate the single-vehicle crash that claimed the lives of four people in Victoria's west on Saturday as the sole survivor makes a steady recovery in a Melbourne hospital.

title.children: Heartbroken town to say goodbye to 'lost angels' as crash victim's mother pleads 'stop looking at the negatives'

image.altText: A man looks down and leans on a mic stand in tears.

items.synopsis: Here's everything you need to know about the new Foo Fighters album and their return to the stage.

title.children: Foo Fighters' new album turns the band's grief into rock 'n' roll

image.altText: A vape in a hand with a playground out of focus in the background

items.synopsis: There has been a drastic rise in vapers under the age of 25, a new study from the Australian Health Department revealed.

title.children: Report shows first increase in Australian teen smoking since the 90s

image.altText: Aerial view of jail facility at Holtze, near Darwin.

items.synopsis: A review into a riot at Darwin Correctional Centre in 2020 finds poor conditions in the prison created "a tense institutional climate".

title.children: Overcrowding, staff shortages 'significant factors' in Darwin prison riot, report finds

image.altText: A person holds a thermometer up to the camera. The person is wearing a medical mask and their face is out of focus.

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

title.children: All the latest COVID-19 case numbers from around Australia — plus the news you may have missed
